result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew T Murray Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the agent but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

No contact with any known drug users/dealers.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

Comply with mental health programming recommended including taking medications as prescribed.
.

timeConds.notes: balance to be served on EM through JSS.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay DOC Supervision fees.

Make payments toward any unpaid financial obligations.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Revocation Summary

PROBATION REVOCATION

EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 2 YEARS w/cond:make paymens on Civil judgment, any other cond left up to PO
All CC & $170 owed to Metropolitan Enforcement group converted to Civil Judgment
S Joseph Randtke

State by Skemp / DRG Crt Team / Def in custody
CRT:  when def absconded the DRG CRT Team rules provide that when individual is not participating the Team has authority to expel a person w/o a Hearing.  Because of lack of def's participation over several weeks, the team took that step.  Rules also state that the def can ask for re-admission.  As it stands today, def has been expelled from DRG CRT &I DOC is in process of revocation.
Def:  I would like to re-apply
CRT:  that is something you need to put in writing - why you would like to come back & plan on how to be successful & ask Team for re-admission
Emma advises def that when he gets atty, Atty can help him re-apply

State by Skemp / DRG CRT Team / Def NA
DRUG COURT EXPULSION
CRT:  def hasn't appeared in last 3 Crt sessions.  Based on absconding behavior, pattern of violations & pattern of non-compliance, a Motion to Expel was made by the DRG CRT Team & 2nded.  Drg CRT Team has authority to expel based on non-participation.
MOTION TO EXPEL IS GRANTED
Patricia O'Neil
Notice not mailed - no current address

Justice Sanctions Violations notice, filed.
SLH: set for hearing
Reminder retd - not deliv as address, unable to foward.
SLH did not realize def was in jail but being released. Def can be released
signed SLH - Time is tolled until he appears

Justice Sanctions Violations notice, filed.
SLH: note & file
for atty fees for Atty Daniel Ryan for $1,550.75 - sent to Finance 7/8/15.
DOC-31 filed - signed by SLH
assigned PO Mark Fries

Def in custody w/atty Ryan
  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed
CRT: sentence withheld 3 years probation w/cond: 4 mths CJ w/credit for 95 days - balance to be served on EM through JSS, AODA & comply, no alcohol or CS w/random testing, pay rset $170 to West Central Meg unit, comply w/mental health programming recommended including taking meds as prescribed, no contact w/drug users/dealers, pay CC + DOC SUpervision fees

9:00 AM - Def in court w/ Atty Daniel P Ryan.  Def in custody.  Jessica Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Crt: got JSS report of bond violation dated 6/18 re: some violations of EM and rather than issuing an OTD I set a hearing but I see he's in custody.
Ryan: he's still on probation and based on the violations his PO put a hold on him and will keep him in until Friday's sentencing. 
Crt: this is a moot point but will order bond be revoked and he remain in custody until the SEH on Friday and will address custody issues at that time.

Justice Sanctions Violations notice, filed.
SLH: set for hearing

Per CRT:  $2500 Sig bond will be in effect as of 6-12-15 - until that date, cash bond remains.  Bond conditions remain same but add:  Def must reside @ Transitional Living Placement & he's to remain there as condition of bond.  It will be a violation of the bond if def leaves the facility for any other reason but one that's approved by the DOC.  If def leaves for any reason other than what's approved, the bond will revert back to a $2500 cash bond & def will return to jail

10:00 AM - Def in court w/ Atty Daniel P Ryan.  Def in custody.  Emily E. Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Ryan: asking that he be released on sig bond on 6/12. He has a transitional living bed. 
Crt: if a person can't comply w/ the bond leading up to sentencing it will be hard for me to conclude that you can comply w/ probation conditions and that would go a long way of ruling probation out and if it is ruled out there's a strong liklihood that prison would be imposed. 
BOND: $2500 sig bond - EFFECTIVE  6/12 - until that day, cash bond remains
Cond: SAME CONDITIONS BUT ADD  THAT DEF RESIDE AT THE TRANSITIONAL LIVING PLACEMENT AND HE'S TO REMAIN THERE AS A CONDITION OF BOND. it will be a violation of the bond if you leave the facility for any other reason but one that's approved by the DOC. If you leave for any reason other than one that's approved the bond will revert back to a $2500.00 cash bond and you are to return to the jail.
PSI assigned to PO Fries
Amended
Sentencing hearing on June 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.

9:34 AM -  Def in court w/ Atty Daniel P Ryan.  Def in custody.  John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information filed
Ct. 1 - delivery of meth w/o repeater - Guilty
remaining charges dismissed and read in
SNP filed/signed/understands
  Plea Quest filed/signed/understands
Understands const rights waived
Understands elements of crime
No promises/threats
No alc/drugs in the last 24 hrs  
Plea is F, V & I made. Sufficient factual basis to support the plea and the def is found guilty.
Ryan: he's set up now for a recommendation of probation but if he goes back to using that could change. There is a benefit to releasing him. 
Kellis: if the PSI recommends prison there would be some risk for flight. 
Crt: leave as is for now but if you can get ltr from PO outlining steps approp for him and that he's a candidate f/ probation. If the DOC recommend sprobation then the state under the terms of the agmt will be bound to make that recommendation as well and under those circumstances I would grant that. If you are released and fail to abide by the terms of the bond, that would make prison much more likely.
SENTENCING: 6 wks - need an hr
PSI DUE 1 wk b/f hearing date

3:36 pm- Def in court w/ Atty Daniel P Ryan.  Def in custody.  Emily E. Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Ryan: he has a $10k cash bond and he was sentenced last wk b/f Br. 5 and will be serving a sentence to be done in Mid May and is still on probation for a felony. His PO is going to place him at ATTIC after that - around mid May. That can't happen if he has a cash bond here. 
Hynek: concerns of this plan. One reason for rev that he was't cooperative w/ the PO. 
Ryan: he's been here or 7-8 yrs. Staying w/ his Aunt and recently at Sal Army. On SSDI, has payee. Will have some resources to try to find housing at ATTIC. 
Crt: he's charged w/ a very serious offense, delivery of meth. Was on probation for 2 convictions from  1/2015 CCW and poss meth. Probation on CCW was revoked and he's con't on the probation for the meth charge. Risk assmt eval and PT report suggested 4 or more prior case filings and 3 or more FTA in court. He's  assessed as high risk. Under the circumstances a cash bond is in order. The incentive not to appear has been reduced somewhat by the fact that he's been given an ATR
BOND: $2500.00 cash bond
Cond: no CS w/o Rx, comply w/JS w/testing, GPS House arrest

from ADA Hynek  re: Prelim Hrg set for 4-6-15.  State req new date since witness is not available.  Def Atty Ryan is notified by copy of this letter
Per SLH:  will still call case on 4-6-15 because def is in custody

11:04 am - Def in court w/ Atty Daniel P Ryan.  Def in custody.  Emily E. Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds   Probable cause found - Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  NG Pleas entered.
PTC: 5/8/15 @ 1:30 (DA)
STC: 5/28/15 @ 10am (SLH)
Same bond and conditions

State by Suleski / Def in custody w/ atty Dan Ryan
Prelim Hrg:  4-6-15 @ 11am w/ SLH
Cash bond to remain
TWB: granted - Dan Ryan - pay $20/mth start 6/1/15
